intro: Canthium pancheri, commonly known as the Indian spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and diverse morphological features. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences, often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Canthium pancheri is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
